content: I just installed sushi on a new machine and it seems that the scripts included in there are still the old version. The functionality is the same but that version of the scripts tends to upset some antivirus.

the new scripts do not have that issue (at the cost of no longer supporting Windows 7).
@Chris Moesel

Thanks for the heads up, @Jose Costa Teixeira. I noticed that the mac and windows update publisher scripts have different behaviors (i.e., windows has "self-updating" logic, mac does not). Is there any plan to bring them into alignment?
@Patrick Werner wanted to look at it
still on my list :cold_sweat:
anyway @Chris Moesel I'd recommend to update at least the .bat. Otherwise it triggers some antivirus.
